FARMING
Throughout history, agriculture has been an important part of the Guernseyman's life. Before the Elizabethan Age production was mainly on a subsistence level and the 'Cottage ' industry was the most important source of income on the island. During the nineteenth century, vineries began to appear. Grapes were the main crop, also melons and figs were grown on a lesser scale. Agricultural production soared and in 1890 a new crop was intoduced, Tomatoes. These wrre grown outside and did not become the main crop of Guernsey until just before the Second World War, when glasshouses sprung up ,overnight.
